ygData.subject: Re: OOC: NBW IMPORTANT
ygData.msgSnippet: New Age was really just a working title, but if everybody likes it, I guess it can stay. However, the basic thing is that the storyline jumps forward in time

New Age was really just a working title, but if everybody likes it, I guess 
it can stay. However, the basic thing is that the storyline jumps forward in 
time by one or two centuries. This doesn't mean that you lose your 
characters in a sort of restart; what it means is that Unicron, before 
leaving the place, locks down the chars present. They then wake up in a 
world where things are radically different.

Oh, and thanks about the comment about it being well written! =)

>From: rm2kmidi <kraftlos@...>
>Reply-To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: OOC: NBW IMPORTANT
>Date: Mon, 30 May 2005 23:50:36 -0700
>
>OOC: Well written, good job.  Does the name New Age mean that we're
>going with the time jump?  If so, are we creating new characters or
>just keeping the same ones?  This sounds like fun ^_^
>
>On 5/30/05, Airly <airly2002@...> wrote:
> > Okey
> >
> > As some of your knows NBW will go to change a little its story line, and
> > here's some ideas that Azure was working on. The plan is to keep ya 
>update
> > and choose the best course of action in order to cheer ups this RPG and
> > upgrade it to next level. THis is one of several ideas that may appear 
>and
> > all will be welcome to be heard. Also, it was suggested to change the 
>name
> > to Neo Beast War, New Age; but other titles will be considered too.
> >
> > Here's what Azure has wrote.
> >
> > ________________________________
> >
> >
> > Neo Beast Wars: New Age
> >
> >
> >
> > Historical Facts
> >
> >
> >
> >   After Unicron left the periphery of the system, he left several 
>sleeping
> > Minions on the moon. He had realized that the energon present on Earth 
>was
> > too powerful for him to absorb right away, and had decided to keep a
> > watchful eye on the planet until the crystals were ripe for his taking. 
>With
> > the Cybertronians out of his way, he went pleased with himself.
> >
> >             Yet before the Minions could awake, there came the wreckage 
>of
> > the Mephilis, a slaver ship. The crash on Earth caused the deaths of 
>most of
> > the slave drivers, and those who survived were met with the wrathful
> > vengeance of the now free slaves. The slaves were from all known 
>transformer
> > factions and builds, a few even dating back to the era of the Great 
>Wars.
> > They all formed a loose society, agreeing that slavery was to be banned 
>from
> > their hearts, and punishable by death.
> >
> >             Fifteen years passed, and the Mephilis survivors were then
> > joined by the crews of rescue ships that had finally managed to track 
>them
> > down. Contact was re-established with Cybertron, and colons started
> > arriving, forming high-tech cities that were designed to ensure a 
>central
> > government on the planet. Industry and economy were bustling, and 
>everybody
> > was happy.
> >
> >             Or rather, they would have been. The Minions awoke and soon, 
>a
> > sort of Cold War was raging between the Unicronians and the 
>Cybertronians,
> > but also between the Cybertronians themselves. Old hatred died hard, and 
>in
> > this case, they even resurrected. The Maximals and Predacons emerged 
>from
> > the colonies and mistrust became rampant. Yet, some felt that it was 
>their
> > duties to make sure the Minions were being watched. Some, no matter 
>their
> > personal allegiance, collaborated and formed the Watchers, keeping the
> > Unicronians in check while others were embarking on a power trip.
> >
> >  Cities and Locations
> > Olympus Complex: The military heart of the planet. Army training 
>facilities
> > are located there and most weaponry is available from that city. It is
> > located inside a tall mountain, with its higher rises coming out of the
> > rocky top. Most military leaders come from there, such as Lord Jotunn,
> > leader of the Iron Skulls Predacons. Minions are to be shot on sight in
> > Olympus Complex.
> > Atlantis: Located on an ancient island, this city is made up of tall 
>towers
> > and labs where science and knowledge reign supreme. It is the testing 
>ground
> > of experimental technologies. Pacificus Maximals are strong there, with 
>Lord
> > Perseus leading them. Violence in Atlantis results in immediate 
>banishment
> > from the city.
> > Valley Mine Pentatron: As its name implies, this city is a mining city 
>where
> > much of the planet's workforce reside. It is also one of the most 
>industrial
> > cities in the world, and one of the most culturally universal. At the 
>same
> > time, shady business is frequent and law enforcement is not one of the
> > priorities. Lord Spire, leader of the Bushido Predacons, holds her 
>offices
> > there.
> > Cryonosis: This is the Antarctic base of the Watchers. It is loaded with
> > up-to-the-minute stealth and surveillance technology. Not many dwell 
>there,
> > as it is the most environmentally hazardous city, but there are enough
> > people to make Lord Elder, Watcher leader, proud of his achievements. 
>Giving
> > in to faction struggles there can result in jailing.
> > Relay: If the world has a center, this is it. A city in the sky, Relay 
>is
> > where the lords meet and vote, where the Central Government is seated 
>and
> > where the corporations are based. Trade is made from there, and
> > transportations and communications are developed there. Lord Razorwing,
> > leader of the Silver Wings Maximals, is based there. Being found guilty 
>of
> > corruption in Relay is punishable by public execution.
> > Orbital Factories: These are the center of production for the planet.
> > Searing Eye Base: Rumors say that the Minions are building a base on the
> > moon, a tribute to Unicron himself. Nothing is known for sure about it, 
>but
> > red reflections can be seen from the natural satellite at night�
> >  Factions and Groups
> > Bushido Predacons: In the spirit of the warrior's way, these Predacons
> > believe that preserving the peace will allow them to grow strong for the
> > little while they still have before the Minions start an all-out war.
> > Leader: Spire.
> > Iron Skulls Predacons: These Predacons think and proclaim loudly that 
>the
> > Maximals are weak and that they will bring destruction on everybody when 
>the
> > Minions act. They would rather take over the lead from the Maximals and 
>act
> > right now. Leader: Jotunn.
> > Pacificus Maximals: The Pacificus preach that peace is the only way
> > everybody can focus on the efforts against the Minions. Leader: Perseus.
> > Silver Wings Maximals: The Silver Wings are convinced that the Predacons 
>are
> > preparing a revolution and that they want to prepare a strike against 
>them.
> > They think they should take them all out before things get rough. 
>Leader:
> > Razorwing.
> > The Watchers: The Watchers are dedicated to the monitoring of the 
>Minions.
> > They are crafty and swift, and they are renowned Minion-killers at 
>times.
> > Their skills also include diplomacy, however, as members of any factions 
>can
> > join the Watchers. Leader: Elder.
